item.title: Police duties, social work mix with Homeless Outreach Team
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The Homeless Outreach Team within the Oklahoma City Police Department is tasked to connect the city’s homeless population with agencies and organizations. They have a unique role that not all officers, and most city residents, don’t understand. “When I first came onto this unit, a senior officer said that all I was doing on the […]

The post Police duties, social work mix with Homeless Outreach Team appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: OKC police officer charged with murder
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
A nine-year veteran of the Oklahoma City Police Department has been charged with second degree murder and an alternative charge of first-degree manslaughter. He was arrested and booked into the Oklahoma County jail Tuesday. Sgt. Keith Patrick Sweeney was charged by David Prater, district attorney for Oklahoma County, for actions he took while responding to […]

The post OKC police officer charged with murder appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Bike ride turns to fearful encounter with police
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Fear led to more fear Thursday morning as Kelsey Pierce was riding her bike to work at the Tower Theater on NW 23rd Street. A sudden encounter with Oklahoma City police officer James Herlihy at NW 21st and Dewey led to what Pierce described as “complete fear” when the officer handcuffed her and placed her […]

The post Bike ride turns to fearful encounter with police appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Suspect dies in shootout with seven OKC PD officers
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Oklahoma City police officer Mohammed Tabiai and six officers from the gang unit were looking for Dorsey Glenn Taulbee Jr. on the near southwest side of Oklahoma City before midnight and then into Wednesday morning, June 12. It is Tabiai’s regular patrol area. They were familiar with Taulbee, a 33-year-old felon whose aggressive behaviors had […]

The post Suspect dies in shootout with seven OKC PD officers appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Police and residents connect at south side “Coffee with a Cop”
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Sleepy people sitting in their cars at the McDonald’s drive-thru lane at SE 44th St. and Shields Boulevard in Oklahoma City Wednesday were in for a surprise. When they pulled up to the window it wasn’t the usual McDonald’s uniforms they saw inside. Oklahoma City Police officers Tom Myers, Elizabeth Heard and Sgt. Ray Swearingen […]

The post Police and residents connect at south side “Coffee with a Cop” appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: From immigrant to award-winning police officer
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
For Mohammad Tabiai, it’s been a productive process of immigrating from Morocco and ending up an award-winning police officer in the Oklahoma City Police Department. After having received several letters of commendation from his commander, he then received a commendation for exceptional service from the Oklahoma City Council Tuesday. The city named him South Oklahoma […]

The post From immigrant to award-winning police officer appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: OKC Police body cams to be back by Jan. 1 – Civil rights leaders pleased
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The five-month logjam in negotiations over body-worn cameras has finally been broken between the Oklahoma City Police Department and Fraternal Order of Police Lodge #123. The union represents the department’s officers. Police Chief Bill Citty and FOP President Jon George expressed relief, as did several civil rights leaders Citty invited to speak at a police […]

The post OKC Police body cams to be back by Jan. 1 – Civil rights leaders pleased appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.
